page.title: 09Housing
page.content: Housing is very scattered & because of the Kent Structure Plan & Metropolitan Green Belt Policies there is a presumption against house building the exception being the conversion of barns & oasts &, in the case of proved need, for a dwelling for a farm worker. Consent is sometimes given for the extension of small cottages. There have been 3 cases of converting 2 or 3 cottages, previously tenanted, into gentrified houses. The majority of houses are owner occupied with few rented cottages. The recent policy of selling council houses, and high cost of housing in general in the area prevents young people of modest means being able to remain here.
